name: Ralph Loop
description: Continuous self-referential AI loops for interactive iterative development, implementing the Ralph Wiggum technique. Run Claude in a while-true loop with the same prompt until task completion.
longDescription: Uses a stop hook to intercept Claude's exit and re-feed the original prompt, creating a continuous self-correcting loop. Provides 3 commands: `/ralph-loop` to start with a task description, `/cancel-ralph` to stop, and `/help` for usage. Supports `--max-iterations` to prevent runaway loops. Each iteration sees prior file changes and git history, enabling autonomous refinement for tasks like fixing test suites or processing file batches.
